summary: Train a CNN model for filtering variants

arguments.summary: Which set of annotations to use.
arguments.name: --annotation-set

arguments.summary: Shortcut connections on the annotation layers.
arguments.name: --annotation-shortcut

arguments.summary: Number of units connected to the annotation input layer
arguments.name: --annotation-units

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Store the channels in the last axis of tensors, tensorflow->true, theano->false
arguments.name: --channels-last

arguments.summary: Batch normalize convolution layers
arguments.name: --conv-batch-normalize

arguments.summary: Dropout rate in convolution layers
arguments.name: --conv-dropout

arguments.summary: Height of convolution kernels
arguments.name: --conv-height

arguments.summary: List of number of filters to use in each convolutional layer
arguments.name: --conv-layers

arguments.summary: Width of convolution kernels
arguments.name: --conv-width

arguments.summary: Maximum number of training epochs.
arguments.name: --epochs

arguments.summary: Batch normalize fully-connected layers
arguments.name: --fc-batch-normalize

arguments.summary: Dropout rate in fully-connected layers
arguments.name: --fc-dropout

arguments.summary: List of number of filters to use in each fully-connected layer
arguments.name: --fc-layers

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Path where plots and figures are saved.
arguments.name: --image-dir

arguments.summary: Directory of training tensors to create.
arguments.name: --input-tensor-dir

arguments.summary: Name of the model to be trained.
arguments.name: --model-name

arguments.summary: Directory where models will be saved, defaults to current working directory.
arguments.name: --output-dir

arguments.summary: Padding for convolution layers, valid or same
arguments.name: --padding

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: Spatial dropout on convolution layers
arguments.name: --spatial-dropout

arguments.summary: Type of tensors to use as input reference for 1D reference tensors and read_tensor for 2D tensors.
arguments.name: --tensor-type

options.summary: 1 Hot encoding of a reference sequence.
options.name: reference

options.summary: Read tensor are 3D tensors spanning aligned reads, sites and channels. The maximum number of reads is a hyper-parameter typically set to 128. There are 15 channels in the read tensor. They correspond to the reference sequence data (4), read sequence data (4), insertions and deletions (2) read flags (4) and mapping quality (1).
options.name: read_tensor

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Number of training steps per epoch.
arguments.name: --training-steps

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: Number of validation steps per epoch.
arguments.name: --validation-steps

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Train a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for filtering variants. This tool expects requires training data generated by CNNVariantWriteTensors.

Inputs

  • data-dir The training data created by CNNVariantWriteTensors.
  • The --tensor-type argument determines what types of tensors the model will expect. Set it to "reference" for 1D tensors or "read_tensor" for 2D tensors.

Outputs

  • output-dir The model weights file and semantic configuration json are saved here. This default to the current working directory.
  • model-name The name for your model.

Usage example

Train a 1D CNN on Reference Tensors

 gatk CNNVariantTrain \
   -tensor-type reference \
   -input-tensor-dir my_tensor_folder \
   -model-name my_1d_model

Train a 2D CNN on Read Tensors

 gatk CNNVariantTrain \
   -input-tensor-dir my_tensor_folder \
   -tensor-type read-tensor \
   -model-name my_2d_model
name: CNNVariantTrain
